titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hartford Art School collection ARCH047
titlestmt.author: Word document finding aid was last updated in 2012 by Margaret Mair. Transcribed to ArchivesSpace by Sean Parke in Dec. 2015. Revised by Sean Parke in Jan. 2016. Theses series described by student volunteer, Monique McDonald, Jun. 2019.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-17 10:03:08 -0400.

change.item: Revised to reflect additions and changes from Acc. 2017-06-16-02

Theses added back to the collection as a series (was accidentally made an independent collection during the 2015 inventory). The series was previously not described below the series level, now the finding aid lists each thesis.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Hartford. Hartford Art School

did.abstract: The collection consists of the records of the Hartford Art School, as well as material about the school and its history.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers. Some clippings files are restricted due to their condition. These folders are marked as restricted. These clippings have been photocopied and the photocopies are accessible in the collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: A portion of the collection has been digitized and can be accessed at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu. Access to the digital repository is limited to the University of Hartford Campus.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Hartford Art School was originally founded in 1877 as the Decorative Arts Society of Hartford. The school became one of the three schools that came together in 1957 to form the University of Hartford.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection previously was assigned multiple subject-based call numbers to different sections of the collection. The collection was originally shelved using an alphanumeric system starting with HA. In 2015, one call number, ARCH047, was assigned to the entire collection. In Dec. 2015 and Jan. 2016, the collection was reprocessed. During reprocessing most folders and boxes were replaced (some folders were reused and relabeled); photographs were placed in protective sleeves; some excessive duplicates were weeded; and some material was rearranged. The rearrangement was intended to be as minimal as possible, with the goal to make more explicit series (no series were named in the previous finding aid) and easier to use. The most rearrangement occurred in the HAS Auxiliary series. The five filenames in the series were based on the previous filenames; however, the previous folders were in no chronological order with several different folders overlapping with each other. The contents of folders with the same or similar filenames were removed, rearranged, and placed in new folders in order by year. The previous finding aid is available in the collection's file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains records of the Hartford Art School, as well as material gathered about the school. The collection contains some histories written about the school, photographs and information about the art school's buildings and facilities; financial records; Corporator, Board, and Committee records; information and clippings about art school personnel; records of the HAS Auxiliary and their popular House and Garden Tours; materials pertaining to events and exhibitions of student and faculty works; photographs and clippings of HAS Students; and copies of student publications and theses (1969-1988). Most of the material dates from the early 1900s through the 1980s. The Hartford Art School Inc. also maintains an archive which contains some of the school's earliest records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 13 series: I. History; II. Buildings; III. Anniversaries; IV. Accreditations and Self-studies; V. Corporators, Board of Trustees, and Committees; VI. Personnel; VII. Finances; VIII. HAS Publications and Public Relations; IX. Events; X. HAS Auxiliary; XI. Students; XII. Student Publications; XIII. Theses.

controlaccess.subject: University of Hartford -- Employees
Student publications
controlaccess.corpname: University of Hartford. Hartford Art School Auxiliary
University of Hartford. Hartford Art School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains many histories written about the Hartford Art School and its early years as the Hartford Art Society (also known as the Art Society of Hartford and the Society of Decorative Art).

did.unittitle: HAS early years and history of House and Garden Tours

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of her thesis "Women as Cultural Entrepreneurs in the Gilded Age: The Art Society of Hartford" and a photocopy of her article based on this thesis called "An Art School Forged in the Gilded Age" from the Hog River Journal (undated).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files related to the buildings of the Hartford Art School, including documents, photographs, and architectural drawings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files regarding different anniversaries celebrated by the Hartford Art School.

did.unittitle: 85th anniversary exhibition at G. Fox and Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains accreditation and self-study reports for the Hartford Art School.

did.unittitle: Series V: Corporators, Board of Trustees, and Committees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of the Board of Trustees and their committees, as well as clippings and photographs of some of their members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by filename.

did.unittitle: Trustee - Lasbury, Mrs. Ralph C. Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of clippings regarding specific personnel of the Hartford Art School. It also consists of faculty meeting minutes (Sept. 1964- May 1970); syllabi (1964-1965); and a card index of instructors, directors, and artists (located in the faculty and staff subseries).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is split into two sub-series: A) Deans and directors; and B) Faculty and Staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains a letter and a clipping regarding Carl Andre and his stone field sculpture.

did.unittitle: Instructors, directors, and artists card index

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the financial records of the Hartford Art School. The majority of the records pre-date the University of Hartford, only the budget and endowment records contain material from after the merger in 1957.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by filename.

did.unittitle: Series VIII: HAS Publications and Public Relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications and public relation materials produced by the University, as well as publicity materails created by other institutions such as newspapers and magazines reporting about the Hartford Art School. University publications include news releases, catalogs, and brochures/booklets. Note that the catalogs all pre-date the University of Hartford. For catalogs created after the merger, see the "Bulletin course catalogs (ARCH153)" located in the Archives' reading room.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by filename.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For course catalogs created after the Hartford Art School merged with the University of Hartford in 1957, see the Bulletin course catalogs (ARCH153) in the Archives' reading room.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newsletters including the "HAS Newsletter," "HAS Letter," "HAS News," and "The Mirror."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of the scrapbooks consist of newspaper clippings, but the scrapbook in box 16 (1893-1925) also contains correspondence, programs, and tickets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of materials related to student and faculty exhibitions. Material regarding convocations, honors day/night, commencement, visitors to HAS, and the HAS holiday sale is also included. The exhibition material includes promotional fliers and leaflets; books, booklets, and guides about the exhibits (include images of exhibited material); some slides of works; and clippings about exhibitions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by filename.

did.unittitle: Equinox Madness Presents: The Cycle of Life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Hartford Art School Auxiliary was an organization which raised money and promoted the Hartford Art School. This series contains records regarding the auxiliary, such as its constitution, reports, and membership lists. The HAS Auxiliary also organized an annual House and Garden Tour. The records of the tours consist of reports, notes, notebooks, and maps. The publicity materials are primarily newspaper clippings reporting on the tours. Tour books consist of tour information, a map, promotions for the art school, and local advertisements.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files of this series are arranged into: HAS Auxiliary, House and Garden Tour, House and Garden Tour publicity, House and Garden Tour books, and House and Garden Tour posters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of HAS students, a few files regarding specific alumni, and a fire safety public service announcement created in 1976.

did.unittitle: Amelia Montague Watson by Linda Smith Cohen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of issues of various student publications of the Hartford Art School. The majority of the publications are from the 1970s and 19080s and present the works of HAS students.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by student publication title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains theses from Hartford Art School students from 1969 to 1988. The theses include writings, as well as photographs or slides of student artwork. Other theses can be found in the Archives' Theses and dissertations collection (ARCH147), which are cataloged and searchable in the Harrison Libraries' catalog.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by the author's last name.
